author: Ted Byrne
content: Curious  the un-noisy detail in the shadows. But particularly interesting in the detail not so much in the shadows but in the black paint on the black car. Now the ISO of 80 helps to explain the large lack of noise. But the tonal range in the black paint is quite acceptably deep - a characteristic that goes beyond sharpness and even contrast. Now some of that is a tribute to the lens used, but much is also an interesting comment upon the processor. It's a step beyond the black dog on the black background at night test. An interesting technological accomplishment, eh?
